headline.main: Belgrade Court Further Stymies Cooperation With Tribunal

lead_paragraph: The Constitutional Court scrapped a government decree today that would have allowed the government to hand over suspects to the international war crimes tribunal. ''The decree on procedures of cooperation with the international criminal tribunal is not in accordance with the constitution of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia and with the law on criminal procedure,'' the court said in a statement.
abstract: Serbian Constitutional Court scraps government decree facilitating hand-over of suspects to international war crimes tribunal; war crimes prosecutor Carla Del Ponte insists no special legislation is needed (S)
